links.*: The Lord of the Rings (film series)

wikitext.*:
'''Ken Kamins''' is a Hollywood agent and executive producer with a pivotal role in the film industry. As [[Peter Jackson]]’s longtime agent and manager Kamins played an important role in securing the production of  [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]] and [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' (film series)]].  Initially representing Jackson in Hollywood, Kamins negotiated with [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Miramax Miramax] but transitioned the project to [[New Line Cinema]] because Miramax wanted only two movies while New Line Cinema proposed three (so they could follow the books.) <ref>https://www.northwestern.edu/magazine/winter2013/feature/lord-of-the-deals.html</ref> After receiving a ‘special thanks’ for his involvement with [[The Lord of the Rings (film series)|''The Lord of the Rings'' (film series)]], he later rejoined Jackson to become an executive producer for [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' (film series).]]

Ken Kamins is CEO of Key Creatives Inc., a management-production company based in Los Angeles, California. Kamins has also collaborated with Jackson in [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Lovely_Bones_(film) The Lovely Bones(film)] <ref> IMDb Ken Kamins https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1353341/bio/?ref_=nm_ov_bio_sm</ref>.
